20101224140156.000|20101224140159.333|TR0|fully-fledged, global missile

20101224140202.667|20101224140206.000|TR0|this regard I'd like to remind

20101224140223.500|20101224140226.000|TR0|situation occurs. And Russia

20101224142243.500|20101224142246.000|TR0|bowed out after reaching the end

20101224142308.500|20101224142311.000|TR0|In the meantime he hands over to
20101224142311.000|20101224142313.500|TR0|his chosen successor, Dilma
20101224142313.500|20101224142316.000|TR0|Rouseff, who won a run-off vote
20101224142316.000|20101224142319.333|TR0|in October. She becomes Brazil's
20101224142319.333|20101224142322.667|TR0|first female leader.
20101224142322.667|20101224142326.000|TR0|
20101224142326.000|20101224142329.333|TR0|It's the season of goodwill, but
20101224142329.333|20101224142332.667|TR0|there's a chill in the air in
20101224142332.667|20101224142336.000|TR0|the Baltic states - and it all
20101224142336.000|20101224142338.500|TR0|because of the origins of the
20101224142338.500|20101224142341.000|TR0|Christmas spruce. Latvia proudly
20101224142341.000|20101224142343.500|TR0|proclaims to be the first, but
20101224142343.500|20101224142346.000|TR0|its neighbours say they're
20101224142346.000|20101224142349.333|TR0|barking up the wrong tree. RT's
20101224142349.333|20101224142352.667|TR0|Oxana Boyko explains.
20101224142352.667|20101224142356.000|TR0|
20101224142356.000|20101224142359.333|TR0|Its a white Christmas in
20101224142359.333|20101224142402.667|TR0|Estonia and Latvia - with fluffy
20101224142402.667|20101224142406.000|TR0|snow, fairy lights and mulled
20101224142406.000|20101224142408.500|TR0|wine. All the ingredients of the
20101224142408.500|20101224142411.000|TR0|proper Christmas spirit. But
20101224142411.000|20101224142413.500|TR0|instead of gifts, there is a
20101224142413.500|20101224142416.000|TR0|pile of historic arguments under
20101224142416.000|20101224142419.333|TR0|the tree. The two neighbours are
20101224142419.333|20101224142422.667|TR0|in a bitter dispute over who was
20101224142422.667|20101224142426.000|TR0|first to come up with the
20101224142426.000|20101224142429.333|TR0|festive fir. Here in Riga, Sasha
20101224142429.333|20101224142432.667|TR0|helps her daughter decorate her
20101224142432.667|20101224142436.000|TR0|fourth Christmas tree. Theyre
20101224142436.000|20101224142438.500|TR0|in no doubt whose spruce shines
20101224142438.500|20101224142441.000|TR0|the brightest - and for the
20101224142441.000|20101224142443.500|TR0|longest time. SOUND-BITE Sasha
20101224142443.500|20101224142446.000|TR0|Kazanina, Latvia resident
20101224142446.000|20101224142449.333|TR0|1.16.56 Of course it is very
20101224142449.333|20101224142452.667|TR0|pleasing to think that the
20101224142452.667|20101224142456.000|TR0|first-ever Christmas tree
20101224142456.000|20101224142459.333|TR0|appeared here in Latvia. And we
20101224142459.333|20101224142502.667|TR0|have historic proof to back this
20101224142502.667|20101224142506.000|TR0|claim. Everybody knows that it
20101224142506.000|20101224142508.500|TR0|was dressed with flowers and
20101224142508.500|20101224142511.000|TR0|berries here in Riga in 1510.
20101224142511.000|20101224142513.500|TR0|But head north, and that
20101224142513.500|20101224142516.000|TR0|theorys being cut down to size.
20101224142516.000|20101224142519.333|TR0|SOUND-BITE Yury Kuskemaa,
20101224142519.333|20101224142522.667|TR0|Estonian art historian 32.00
20101224142522.667|20101224142526.000|TR0|(ENGLISH) Before somebody shows
20101224142526.000|20101224142529.333|TR0|me documents I will not change
20101224142529.333|20101224142532.667|TR0|my mind that Tallinn is the home
20101224142532.667|20101224142536.000|TR0|of the first Christmas tree in
20101224142536.000|20101224142538.500|TR0|the world The festive fracas
20101224142538.500|20101224142541.000|TR0|(pron: frak-AH) has reached such
20101224142541.000|20101224142543.500|TR0|a pitch, that even Santa Claus
20101224142543.500|20101224142546.000|TR0|is weighing in. SOUND-BITE 20.00
20101224142546.000|20101224142549.333|TR0|If you ask Finnish people,
20101224142549.333|20101224142552.667|TR0|theyll tell you there were the
20101224142552.667|20101224142556.000|TR0|ones to invent the Christmas
20101224142556.000|20101224142559.333|TR0|tree. So would the Norwegians
20101224142559.333|20101224142602.667|TR0|and the Germans. I think whats
20101224142602.667|20101224142606.000|TR0|important is not who decorated
20101224142606.000|20101224142608.500|TR0|it first, centuries ago, but
20101224142608.500|20101224142611.000|TR0|that we all do it nowadays.
20101224142611.000|20101224142613.500|TR0|Seasonal spirit aside, this
20101224142613.500|20101224142616.000|TR0|symbol of contention for the two
20101224142616.000|20101224142619.333|TR0|feisty neighbors shows just how
20101224142619.333|20101224142622.667|TR0|much they have in common. PTC
20101224142622.667|20101224142626.000|TR0|Boyko_Baltic 1 10.16 Estonia and
20101224142626.000|20101224142629.333|TR0|Latvia have many ongoing
20101224142629.333|20101224142632.667|TR0|haggles They also disagree
20101224142632.667|20101224142636.000|TR0|whose women are more beautiful,
20101224142636.000|20101224142638.500|TR0|whose beer tastes better and how
20101224142638.500|20101224142641.000|TR0|many bears each nation is
20101224142641.000|20101224142643.500|TR0|allowed to hunt in nearby woods.
20101224142643.500|20101224142646.000|TR0|Some even say without these
20101224142646.000|20101224142649.333|TR0|little arguments life would have
20101224142649.333|20101224142652.667|TR0|been too boring, so the latest
